reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Protection Emergency Response Package Provision for Vulnerable IDPs through mobile teams structure in Idleb and Aleppo.

description.narrative: Responding to the influx of new arrivals IDPs who displaced from SE Idleb and Western Aleppo to safer locations in NW Syria, based on Allocation Strategy Paper of 1st Reserve Allocation 2020,IRD in coordination with protection cluster will respond to the new arriving IDPs in Aleppo and Idleb by provision of protection services including emergency response package, individual protection assistance IPA, and distribution of protection materials. The response will be based on mobile teams’ structure (Annex 16) in a total of 6 mobile teams (1 in Daret Azza,1 in Afrin,and 4 in Dana)sub-districts along with an extension of two protection desks in Maaret Al Ekhwan planned camp MARAM and reception center SAED starting from April 1st The MTs will coordinate on field level with Shafak, Global Communities, and Bahar as protection emergency response focal point in Idleb, Harim and Afrin districts to implement the following emergency response package starting from April 1st: PFA for newly arrivals IDPs Information/Awareness raising on CP, GBV issues Recreational PSS for children Explosive hazards risk education Distribution of Dignity Kits in coordination with UNFPA Distribution of individual PSS kits for children Identify and refer individuals to essential and specialized services Mitigation of protection risks through the provision of in-kind support under IPA framework Enhancing the resilience of IDPs will be achieved by providing PFA, recreational PSS, awareness-raising sessions about CP, GBV, and Risk Education with distributing IEC materials, along with distributing protection materials for IDPs including PSS kits for children, and Dignity kits. PSS kits are individual kits to be distributed for displaced children (boys and girls) (5-13) age group especially in the locations that have lack in PSS services to support the resilience of children in emergency. The kits content is suggested and recommended by CPSC and since IRD is the stock and distribution focal point of UNICEF kits, and UNICEF kits are only to implement activities (recreational, ECD, and adolescent kits) and not for distribution, the project teams will target locations received highest number of IDPs by distributing the individual PSS kits. The response activities are based on updated service mapping according to rapid changes in the field situation and continuous coordination with service providers and will include referrals to specialized services and non-protection services. Individual Protection Assistance IPA will be provided to mitigate the risks of displacement and response to the protection, CP, GBV concerns and will include the provision of in-kind support related to protection, shelter, FSL, NFI, Health, heating, and Transportation. The increase in capacity of GBV services will be achieved by extension of two protection desks established previously because of a gap in GBV prevention and response services in Maaret Al Ikhwan MARAM and SAED camps in coordination with IOM and camps management IRD will provide awareness-raising sessions about GBV concerns, and referrals to specialized and non-specialized services to mitigate GBV risks since this service is provided by IRD till March 31 and will continue during this project starting from April 1. Coordination is a main component in this project and will be achieved by conducting six meetings in Syria level with protection actors in the project locations, along with four meetings with emergency response focal points in Turkey level in coordination with protection cluster and sub-clusters. Protection Monitoring and Child Protection Situation Monitoring surveys will continue through the project teams in 3 main sub-districts in a total of 15 communities by conducting 7 KIIs in each community (3 PM KIIs, 4 CPSM KIIs) after coordination with UNICEF and UNHCR and since IRD is CPMWG Co-Lead will play the role of coordinating the efforts of CP partners by targeting the communities with CPSM surveys.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
